thread.title: Manchester United players blamed for sparking tunnel bust-up after Middlesbrough win
thread.title_full: Manchester United players blamed for sparking tunnel bust-up after Middlesbrough win

title: Manchester United players blamed for sparking tunnel bust-up after Middlesbrough win
text:
Who impressed for Manchester United against Middlesbrough? GETTY Manchester United and Middlesbrough players clashed in the tunnel at the Riverside GETTY Rudy Gestede clashed with Eric Bailly as temperatures boiled over 
“I’m picking up there’s something gone on in the tunnel,” Agnew said. “That many bodies were there, it was hard to tell with all the pushing and showing. What triggered it off I don’t know. 
“I’ve got a group of very, very well behaved players so I can assure you it wouldn’t be one of ours. What I would say it would have been a reaction because of the spirit they have.” 
United defender Phil Jones added: “When emotions are high these things happen but it was something and nothing.” GETTY Antonio Valencia scored as Manchester United battled past Middlesbrough 
Mourinho had inflamed matters before the game by suggesting he “knew the names” of the Middlesbrough players he claimed had been responsible for the departure of Aitor Karanka, his former Real Madrid assistant who was sacked this week. 
Mourinho headed down the tunnel at the final whistle without acknowledging his opposite number, though Agnew confirmed the pair had shaken hands in the tunnel afterwards. Related articles
